turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Anishinaabe.
turn.1: What are the different tribes of Anishinaabe?
turn.2: The cognate "Neshnabé" comes from the Potawatomi, a people long allied with the Odawa and Ojibwe in the Council of Three Fires.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The Nipissing, Mississaugas and Algonquin are identified as Anishinaabe, but are not part of the Council of Three Fires.
turn.5: Do they have any other unique features?
turn.6: Closely related to the Ojibwe and speaking a language mutually intelligible with "Anishinaabemowin" (Anishinaabe language) are the Oji-Cree (also known as "Severn Ojibwe").
turn.7: What do the different tribes have in common?
turn.8: Their most common autonym is "Anishinini" (plural: "Anishininiwag") and they call their language "Anishininiimowin".
turn.9: Do they have any other names for the different tribes?
turn.10: Among the Anishinaabe, the Ojibwe collectively call the Nipissings and the Algonquins "Odishkwaagamii" (those who are at the end of the lake), while those among the Nipissings who identify themselves as Algonquins call the Algonquins proper "Omàmiwinini" (those who are downstream).
turn.11: What other interesting features are there?
turn.12: Not all Anishinaabemowin-speakers call themselves Anishinaabe.
